Age_Note: 5 fractions (abr), concordant to variably discordant, broadly colinear, but likely not within statistical validity (MSWD not reported). This age is mean (identical) 207Pb/206Pb age of 2 near-concordant points
Location: North shore of Grand Lake, Labrador. Coordinates interpolated from sketch map in report (by NGS compilers)
Geological_Info: Groswater Bay terrane - Grand Lake Thrust System (footwall)
Rock_Description: mylonitic paragneiss
References: Philippe, S., Wardle, R.J. and Scharer, U., 1993. Labradorian and Grenvillian crustal evolution of the Goose Bay region, Labrador: new U - Pb geochronological constraints; Canadian Journal of Earth Sciences, v. 30,  p. 2315-2327

Age_Note: 2 fractions, near-concordant and overlapping. Age is mean 207Pb/206Pb age. Zircons also recovered, variety of populations, poor quality - not analyzed.
Location: Alexis Bay, Labrador. Coordinates approximated from detailed sketch map in report relative to on-line digital mapping of NGS
Geological_Info: Gilbert River Belt - Alexis Bay gneiss
Rock_Description: polydeformed granodioritic gneiss
References: Scott, D.J., Machado, N., Hanmer, S. and Gariepy, C., 1993. Dating ductile deformation using U-Pb geochronology: examples from the Gilbert River Belt, Grenville Province, Labrador, Canada; Canadian Journal of Earth Sciences, v. 30,  p. 1458-1469

Age_Note: Single concordant (>0.1%) fraction, age is 207Pb/206Pb age.
Location: No topographic description.
Geological_Info: Mesoproterozoic Composite Arc allochthon - Parry Sound domain
Rock_Description: metapelitic gneiss
References: Tuccillo, M.E., Mezger, K., Essene, E.J. and van der Pluijm, B.A., 1992. Thermobarometry, geochronology and the interpretation of P-T-t data in the Britt domain, Ontario Grenville Orogen, Canada; Journal of Petrology, v. 33,  p. 1225-1259

Age_Note: Weighted average 207Pb/235U age, N=2; 0.3% and 0.2% disc. A third concordant analysis yields 1001 ? 2 Ma.
Location: western shore of the western arm of the U-shape Musquaro lake
Geological_Info: Eastern Grenville - Grey, polymictic lapillistones, of intermediate composition
Rock_Description: None
References: van Breemen, O. and Corriveau, L., 2005. U-Pb age constraints on arenaceous and volcanic rocks of the Wakeham Group, eastern Grenville Province; Canadian Journal of Earth Sciences, v. 42

Age_Note: 2 fractions, 1 is concordant with U-Pb ages as given. 207Pb/206Pb age is 985 ?5 Ma.
Location: Near Country Cat Pond, Labrador. Coordinates approximated from sketch map in report.
